issues.description: The problem statement’s UML and solution define StockIngredient.price as an `int`, but the template declares it as `double` (and the constructor takes a `double`), causing a type mismatch when students implement `calculateTotalPrice` (which sums prices into an `int`). This will result in compilation errors (“possible loss of precision”) and confusion over the expected price type.
issues.suggested_fix: Update the template’s `StockIngredient` to use an `int price` (and constructor parameter `int price` and `int getPrice()`), matching the UML and reference solution.
